intro: Lyonnetia tenuiloba, commonly known as the slender Lyonnetia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, palmate leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, with five petals and a central cluster of stamens. Lyonnetia tenuiloba is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
